results_summary: The abstract mentions that chitosan, among other polymers, has not been FDA-approved for lung application, and formulation stability remains a challenge for heparin-loaded systems. No specific results on chitosan's efficacy or safety are provided.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of lung disease applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the challenges and formulation-related difficulties of siRNA therapeutics, with a focus on identifying ideal carriers such as chitosan for clinical applications.
results_summary: The abstract highlights chitosan as one of the promising non-viral polymers for siRNA delivery, but it does not provide specific efficacy data for chitosan alone. The review emphasizes the need for stable and efficient carriers to advance siRNA therapeutics.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of chitosan-N-acetylcysteine (C-NAC) eye drops on tear film thickness in patients with dry eye syndrome.
results_summary: A single instillation of C-NAC significantly increased mean tear film thickness within 10 minutes, lasting 24 hours, with comparable effects to twice-daily use over 5 days. Corneal damage improved in over 60% of patients, and symptoms of ocular discomfort and conjunctival redness were reduced.
population_specificity: Patients with dry eye syndrome (38 total participants across two cohorts).
effective_dosage: Single instillation or once/twice daily for 5 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the properties and applications of chitosan and its derivatives as wound dressings, focusing on its role in skin healing and regeneration.
results_summary: Chitosan exhibits antimicrobial, healing, and oxygen-permeable properties, making it suitable for wound and burn treatment. Modified chitosan forms show promise as next-generation skin substitutes for full-thickness wounds.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of three carboxymethyl chitosan nanoparticles (OC, NC, NOC) as drug carriers for docetaxel in anti-tumor applications.
results_summary: OC-NPs showed faster drug release, higher cellular accumulation in gastric carcinoma cells, and stronger cytotoxicity compared to NC-NPs and NOC-NPs, suggesting OC-based nanoparticles are more effective for drug delivery.
population_specificity: Human gastric carcinoma cells (SGC 7901)

study_goal: The abstract does not mention Chitosan or its evaluation.
results_summary: The abstract does not discuss Chitosan or its effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract focuses on open fractures, not Chitosan).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent applications of chitosan and its derivatives in cancer therapy, focusing on its roles in gene delivery, chemotherapeutic delivery, and immunoadjuvant properties.
results_summary: The study highlights chitosan's multifaceted applications in cancer therapy, including its effectiveness in gene and chemotherapeutic delivery and as an immunoadjuvant for vaccines. The abstract emphasizes chitosan's biocompatibility and biodegradability, making it suitable for biomedical applications.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of biomedical applications)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate chitosan's potential as a treatment for osteoarthritis, focusing on its ability to promote cartilage repair, reduce inflammation, and serve as a viscosupplement.
results_summary: In vitro studies showed chitosan promoted cartilage matrix expression and reduced inflammatory mediators. In vivo, chitosan prevented cartilage degradation and synovial inflammation in an OA-induced rabbit model, and it also induced chondrogenic differentiation of mesenchymal stem cells.
population_specificity: OA-induced rabbit model (in vivo); chondrocytes and mesenchymal stem cells (in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent chitosan-based nanoparticles for accurate cancer imaging and effective treatment, focusing on minimizing side effects compared to conventional therapies.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan-based nanoparticles show promise in improving cancer imaging (optical and magnetic resonance) and treatment (chemo-, gene, photothermal, photodynamic, and magnetic therapies) while minimizing side effects on healthy tissues.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the neuroprotective properties of chitosan and acetylated chitosan oligosaccharides, focusing on their therapeutic effects in neuronal disorders like Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, and nerve crush injury.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan oligosaccharides exhibit therapeutic effects on various neuronal disorders by addressing common sub-cellular mechanisms such as atypical protein assemblies and neuronal death, as well as chronic immune activation. The review highlights recent progress in understanding their structural features and molecular mechanisms.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research on neuronal disorders).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of hyaluronic acid (HA) and human serum albumin (HSA) coated chitosan nanoparticles (MTX-CsNPs) in improving antitumor activity against breast cancer cells.
results_summary: The study found that HA and HSA coated MTX-CsNPs improved antitumor activity compared to uncoated nanoparticles and free methotrexate, with HA molecular weight and concentration influencing nanoparticle charge density.
population_specificity: MCF-7 breast cancer cell lines

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the applications of chitosan-based drug delivery systems, particularly for local delivery in anti-cancer chemoembolization, tissue engineering, and stem cell research.
results_summary: Chitosan-based systems, including microparticles, hydrogels, and nanoparticles, were found effective for targeted drug delivery, particularly in occluding blood vessels and locally releasing anti-cancer drugs or radioactive materials for hepatocellular carcinoma treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (focused on biomedical applications rather than a specific human or animal population).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of free and nanoencapsulated cinnamon bark extract (CBE) on the safety and quality of fresh-cut lettuce, specifically evaluating chitosan-PNIPAAM encapsulated CBE's antimicrobial efficacy against *Listeria monocytogenes*.
results_summary: Chitosan-PNIPAAM encapsulated CBE was the most effective antimicrobial treatment, reducing bacterial load by up to 2 log. The study demonstrated that nanoencapsulation enhances the antimicrobial efficacy of CBE in fresh produce.
population_specificity: Fresh-cut lettuce contaminated with *Listeria monocytogenes*.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent advancements in using chitosan nanoparticles for targeted anticancer drug delivery.
results_summary: The study highlights chitosan's biocompatibility and potential for effective anticancer drug delivery, with surface-modified nanoparticles showing improved stability, permeability, and bioactivity.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the weight loss effect of a polysaccharide-rich food supplement (BGCC) derived from Saccharomyces cerevisiae in overweight and obese subjects.
results_summary: The study found that daily supplementation of BGCC improved body weight and waist circumference in overweight and obese subjects, with no relevant adverse effects reported.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese subjects (BMI 25-35 kg/m²).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of HemCon Dental Dressing (HDD), a chitosan-based hemostatic agent, in controlling postsurgical bleeding in patients undergoing tooth extraction while on antiplatelet therapy.
results_summary: The study found that HDD had a shorter application time but longer bleeding time compared to the control (CollaPlug). However, HDD resulted in lower postoperative pain and better healing quality.
population_specificity: Outpatients under single-drug antiplatelet treatment undergoing tooth extraction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the synthesis, characterization, and biomedical applications of glycoprotein-based polymers, including chitosan blends.
results_summary: The study highlights chitosan's role in improving properties like thermal stability, mechanical strength, and pH resistance, with potential applications in drug delivery, wound dressing, and cancer therapy.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research)

study_goal: To evaluate the antibacterial efficacy of chitosan and its potential enhancement of photodynamic therapy (PDT) against Enterococcus faecalis in infected root canals.
results_summary: The combination of PDT and chitosan showed the lowest bacterial count (CFU/mL) and contamination area, indicating strong antibacterial potential against E. faecalis. Chitosan alone was not directly compared, but its synergy with PDT was evident.
population_specificity: Extracted human teeth experimentally infected with E. faecalis (in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review non-viral nanoparticle-mediated gene therapy approaches, including Chitosan, for modulating angiogenesis in diseases like ischemia, cancer, and macular degeneration.
results_summary: The abstract summarizes recent gene therapy applications and proposes enhanced nanoparticle design strategies to improve efficacy, but does not provide specific findings on Chitosan's effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of pre-clinical and clinical trials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of 15% chitosan gel as a periodontal regenerative material in intrabony defects compared to standard open flap debridement.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in clinical and radiographic parameters, with a mean difference in clinical attachment level (5.8 ± 1.398 mm) and intrabony defect depth (3.41 ± 1.17 mm) at 9 months compared to baseline, indicating chitosan gel's potential for periodontal regeneration.
population_specificity: 10 patients aged 30-55 years with bilateral intrabony defects ≥ 3mm and clinical attachment levels ≥ 5mm.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the tumor-targeting efficiency, controlled drug release, and antitumor efficacy of chitosan-coated ursolic acid liposomes (CS-UA-L) in cervical cancer models.
results_summary: The CS-UA-L demonstrated high tumor-targeting ability, rapid drug release at pH5.0, significant anti-proliferative effects (76.46% in HeLa cells), and antitumor activity (61.26% in mice with U14 cervical cancer), along with enhanced apoptosis and reduced cell proliferation in tumor tissues.
population_specificity: Mice bearing U14 cervical cancer and HeLa cells (in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of a chitosan-containing gel on wound healing and postoperative side effects after impacted mandibular third molar extraction.
results_summary: The chitosan gel did not significantly improve postoperative comfort (pain/swelling) but enhanced wound healing aesthetically. No poor healing or infections were observed in either group.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing bilateral and symmetrical impacted mandibular third molar extractions (n=50).
effective_dosage: 10 ml of topical gel applied three times daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent advances in the delivery of small non-coding RNAs (sncRNAs) using biodegradable biopolymers, including chitosan, focusing on their potential applications in human health and disease treatment.
results_summary: The abstract highlights chitosan as a biodegradable, biocompatible, and nontoxic biopolymer for sncRNA delivery but does not provide specific results on its efficacy or safety in clinical applications.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article, not a clinical study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of nanoparticles, including chitosan, in influencing protein folding and preventing aggregation to potentially treat neurodegenerative disorders.
results_summary: The study suggests that nanoparticles like chitosan can form dynamic nanoparticle-protein coronas, potentially inducing conformational changes in proteins and aiding in proper folding to prevent aggregation, which may be beneficial for neurodegenerative disease treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (theoretical or in vitro study implied)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of carboxymethyl chitosan-based bioresorbable microspheres for arterial embolization in hypervascular tumors.
results_summary: The study found that carboxymethyl chitosan crosslinked with carboxymethyl cellulose forms drug-loadable microspheres suitable for embolization, with size ranges comparable to commercial non-resorbable alternatives.
population_specificity: Hypervascular tumor patients (implied, not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate a mucoadhesive film containing Chitosan, CBS, and ornidazole for treating oral mucosal ulcers.
results_summary: The film showed favorable drug release and swelling properties, significantly relieved mucosal wounds in rabbits, and maintained effective salivary ornidazole concentrations in healthy volunteers. The combination film performed better than films containing only CBS or ornidazole.
population_specificity: Rabbits with induced oral ulcers and healthy human volunteers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the application of antibacterial nanoparticles, including Chitosan, in improving antibiofilm efficacy in root canal and restorative treatments.
results_summary: The study found that nanoparticles, including Chitosan, enhance antibiofilm efficacy when used in irrigation solutions, medications, and as additives in sealers/restorative materials. Functionalized nanoparticles with antibiotics or photosensitizers were proposed for more potent antibacterial effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of nanoparticle applications in endodontics).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review current clinical treatments and preclinical approaches for rotator cuff tear repair, including new repair strategies and animal models.
results_summary: The abstract does not mention Chitosan or its effects, focusing instead on rotator cuff tear treatments and animal models.
population_specificity: Not specified (abstract discusses general rotator cuff tear patients and animal models).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the characteristics, preparation methods, applications, and limitations of chitosan nanoparticles as a vaccine adjuvant and delivery carrier, particularly for mucosal immunity.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan nanoparticles exhibit low toxicity, better biodegradability, and adhesivity, making them effective as delivery carriers for vaccine antigens and drugs. The review highlighted their promising applications in vaccine and drug delivery systems, though challenges remain.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing literature).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the advances in chitosan-based nanoparticles, focusing on their therapeutic potential in cancer treatment.
results_summary: The study highlights chitosan's excellent biocompatibility and its role as a carrier for drug and gene delivery in cancer therapy, emphasizing its targeting ability, prolonged circulation, enhanced efficacy, and reduced side effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on cancer treatment applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize current knowledge on the preparation methods, pharmacokinetic profiles, biological activities, therapeutic applications, and safety of Chitosan oligosaccharide (COS) and its derivatives.
results_summary: The study found that COS exhibits multiple biological activities, including anti-inflammatory, immunostimulatory, anti-tumor, and anti-microbial effects, mediated through modulation of pathways like NF-κB, MAPK, and AMPK. It also highlighted COS's water solubility, non-cytotoxicity, and efficient absorption and excretion.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of existing research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of chitosan as part of semi-synthetic biopolymer complexes (SSBCs) for oral drug delivery, focusing on its structural and functional attributes.
results_summary: The abstract highlights chitosan as a broadly studied natural polymer for nanoparticle systems, emphasizing its role in SSBCs for oral drug delivery, but does not provide specific efficacy results.
population_specificity: Not specified (review study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent advances in the preparation and use of chitosan nanoparticles for pulmonary drug delivery, including their efficacy and toxicological effects.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan nanoparticles show promise for improved targeting and controlled release of therapeutic agents (drugs, genes, vaccines) via pulmonary delivery, though toxicological effects remain controversial.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the toxic effects of engineered nanoparticles, including Chitosan, on mammalian germ cells and developing embryos, and propose potential treatment strategies to mitigate toxicity.
results_summary: The abstract indicates that Chitosan, among other nanoparticles, may induce toxicity via oxidative stress, inflammation, and DNA damage in germ cells, but also highlights its potential for gene delivery applications in reproductive biology.
population_specificity: Mammalian germ cells and developing embryos (in vitro and in vivo models).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate chitosan as a potential carrier for antihypertensive drugs to improve oral bioavailability, reduce side effects, and enhance drug delivery.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan-based nano-carriers can enhance the oral bioavailability and plasma half-life of antihypertensive drugs while reducing hydrophobicity and side effects. Chitosan's muco-adhesive properties, biocompatibility, and biodegradability make it a promising candidate for targeted drug delivery.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on cardiovascular disease patients).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to demonstrate the effectiveness of a product containing hydroxypropyl chitosan, climbazole, and piroctone olamine in improving clinical symptoms through biweekly application.
results_summary: The study found significant clinical improvement, with complete resolution of symptoms in 100% of cases after 2 months, as documented by dermoscopy and digital photos. Confocal microscopy confirmed the persistence of the product in the stratum corneum over time.
population_specificity: 30 patients (17 males, 13 females; average age 20.8 years) from three dermatological centers in Italy.
effective_dosage: Topical spray applied 2 evenings a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the relationship between cell culture models, cellular trafficking, and siRNA silencing efficiency using chitosan as a condensing agent to inform siRNA delivery system design.
results_summary: The study found significant differences in internalization behavior and gene silencing efficiency among lung epithelial cell lines, with clathrin-mediated pathways showing lower silencing efficiency in Calu-3 cells compared to non-clathrin pathways in H1299 cells. Endosomal disruption improved silencing in Calu-3 cells but not in A549 cells, highlighting the importance of understanding cell trafficking pathways for effective siRNA delivery.
population_specificity: Lung epithelial cell lines (H1299, A549, Calu-3)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the utility of various biomaterials, including Chitosan, as drug delivery systems for anti-inflammatory drugs in ophthalmic therapeutics.
results_summary: The abstract highlights Chitosan as the most explored natural biopolymer due to its inherent characteristics, such as safety, ease of elimination, and ability to sustain drug release, making it suitable for ocular drug delivery. The study also notes the emergence of synthetic biopolymers as additional options for treating ophthalmic inflammations.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of biomaterials for ophthalmic use)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a novel iodine carrier using carboxymethyl chitosan for postoperative wound care after LEEP procedures to prevent infection and improve healing.
results_summary: The study found that the CMCTS-g-(PAANa-co-PVP)-I2 complex exhibited broad-spectrum antimicrobial activity and pH-dependent iodine release. Clinical trials indicated better treatment effectiveness compared to conventional methods.
population_specificity: Women undergoing LEEP procedures for cervical erosion.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the physicochemical properties and cytotoxicity of chitosan-alginate membranes derived from fungal and animal sources for potential use in skin wound treatments.
results_summary: Fungal chitosan membranes exhibited higher porosity, thickness, roughness, opacity, liquid uptake, and water vapor permeability compared to animal-derived chitosan. The membranes showed negligible cytotoxicity, with fungal chitosan-surfactant combinations displaying the lowest cytotoxicity (0.16-0.21%).
population_specificity: In vitro study using fibroblasts (no human or animal subjects).
effective_dosage: Not specified (1:1 mass ratio of chitosan-alginate membranes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Holmium-166 chitosan as an alternative radiopharmaceutical for intra-arterial therapy for liver tumors.
results_summary: The abstract mentions Holmium-166 chitosan as an introduced alternative for intra-arterial therapy, but no specific results regarding its efficacy or safety are provided.
population_specificity: Patients with unresectable primary and metastatic liver tumors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effectiveness of various nanocarriers, including chitosan nanoparticles, for oral insulin delivery in diabetes management.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan nanoparticles, among other nanocarriers, improved oral insulin absorption and bioavailability (up to 14%), leading to effective glycemic control in in vivo models. Active and passive targeting approaches enhanced insulin delivery.
population_specificity: In vivo models (not specified if human or animal).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether intranasal immunization with chitosan as an adjuvant could enhance mucosal immune responses compared to other routes of administration for an HIV-1 vaccine.
results_summary: Intranasal immunization with chitosan-primed subjects showed an anamnestic antibody response after intramuscular boosting, but systemic and mucosal antibody levels were significantly lower than those elicited by intramuscular immunization alone. Interestingly, the strongest CD4 T-cell responses were detected after intranasal immunization.
population_specificity: HIV-negative female volunteers

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of chitosan, as a natural polysaccharide, in drug delivery systems for pulmonary administration.
results_summary: Chitosan-based nanoparticles successfully delivered various drugs via the pulmonary route, with entrapment efficiency dependent on formulation and manufacturing methods. Large-scale production remains technically challenging but can be improved with continuous manufacturing and spray drying.
population_specificity: Not specified (general drug delivery applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of chitosan-hyaluronic acid (CH1) scaffolds in supporting hepatic differentiation of human umbilical cord-derived mesenchymal stem cells (hUC-MSCs).
results_summary: The CH1 scaffold supported hepatic differentiation by mimicking the native extracellular matrix, leading to improved cell morphology, expression of hepatic markers, and metabolic activities compared to Matrigel-coated plates. The differentiated cells exhibited hepatocyte-like functions, including glycogen storage, urea production, albumin secretion, and CYP450 activity.
population_specificity: Human umbilical cord-derived mesenchymal stem cells (hUC-MSCs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential applications of chitosan in endodontic treatment, particularly its effectiveness against resistant microorganisms and biocompatibility with periapical tissues.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan exhibits potential effectiveness against resistant microorganisms like E. faecalis and C. albicans, along with anti-inflammatory, antifungal, and antiseptic properties, making it suitable for endodontic treatment. It also highlights chitosan's biocompatibility compared to commonly used synthetic agents.
population_specificity: Dental science, specifically endodontics (root canal treatment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the applicability and biochemical impact of chitosan on oral health maintenance across various dental specialties.
results_summary: Chitosan shows promise in multiple dental applications due to its antimicrobial, regenerative, and biocompatible properties, though data on its effectiveness for new bone formation remain inconclusive. It should be considered a potential allergen, warranting further study.
population_specificity: General dental applications (preventive, conservative, endodontics, surgery, periodontology, prosthodontics, orthodontics).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and characterize HSA and PHB-CMCh nanoparticles for use as nanocarriers in cancer therapy, focusing on drug encapsulation and targeted delivery to cancer cells.
results_summary: The study found that HSA nanoparticles had higher entrapment efficiency than PHB-CMCh nanoparticles, and the nanoparticles were successfully modified for active targeting of cancer cells. Cytotoxicity and cellular uptake studies demonstrated interaction with cancer cells.
population_specificity: Cancer cells (in vitro)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the development and current state of chitosan-based nanoparticulate systems for drug delivery, particularly in inflammatory and infectious diseases.
results_summary: The study found that chitosan's properties, such as biocompatibility, biodegradability, and muco-adhesion, make it effective for targeted drug delivery, controlled release, and improving patient compliance in infectious and inflammatory diseases.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the performance of different mucoadhesive polymers, including chitosan, in increasing the residence time of sumatriptan succinate sublingual tablets in the sublingual area.
results_summary: Chitosan was tested as a mucoadhesive polymer to enhance sublingual retention, but the abstract does not specify its comparative performance or effectiveness relative to other polymers. The study focused more on the overall formulation performance, with Pharmaburst®/HPMC being the optimum combination.
population_specificity: Healthy human volunteers

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of polysaccharides, including Chitosan, as natural biomaterials for targeted anticancer drug delivery systems.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that polysaccharides like Chitosan enhance drug solubility, improve bioavailability, and enable the preparation of nanomaterials for delivering antibiotics, anticancer agents, and other therapeutics. These properties make them promising for nanomedicine applications.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article, not a clinical study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate chitosan-based smart drug delivery nanocomplexes for their potential in targeted cancer treatment, focusing on pH-responsiveness and biocompatibility.
results_summary: The study highlights chitosan's potential as a pH-responsive material for cancer drug delivery, capable of targeting tumor microenvironments effectively. It discusses current challenges and strategies to enhance therapeutic efficacy but does not provide specific clinical trial results.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the use of chitosan as a biomaterial for local delivery of chemotherapeutics in regional cancer treatment.
results_summary: The abstract mentions chitosan as one of the biomaterials used as reservoirs for anticancer drugs but does not provide specific findings on its efficacy or safety in this context.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of biomaterials for cancer treatment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the performance of chitosan gel in postoperative hemostasis and wound healing following endoscopic sinus surgery (ESS) for chronic rhinosinusitis.
results_summary: Chitosan gel performed well in achieving postoperative hemostasis and wound healing but did not address mucosal inflammation. The study noted significant heterogeneity among biomaterial studies, preventing a definitive conclusion on superiority.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic rhinosinusitis undergoing endoscopic sinus surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the use of chitosan-based polymeric nanoparticles for targeting colorectal cancer, focusing on preparation strategies, theranostics, and surface engineering.
results_summary: The abstract highlights chitosan's role in facilitating the transition from laboratory to clinical applications for oral and parental administration, particularly in colorectal cancer targeting, but does not provide specific efficacy results.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article, not a clinical study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the biomedical applications of marine polysaccharides, including chitosan, focusing on their properties and potential uses in drug delivery and advanced therapies.
results_summary: The study highlighted chitosan's biocompatibility, biodegradability, anti-inflammatory activity, and antimicrobial properties, as well as its potential for modification into various forms for controlled drug release and use in gene delivery or regenerative medicine.
population_specificity: Not specified (general biomedical applications)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the preparation methods, characterization, and pharmaceutical applications of chitosan micro- and nanoparticles in drug delivery.
results_summary: Chitosan micro- and nanoparticles were found to enhance the stability, permeability, and bioactivity of therapeutic agents such as peptides, proteins, vaccines, DNA, and drugs. The review highlighted the potential of chitosan derivatives and chitosan metal nanoparticles in drug delivery.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review current research on organic nanoparticles, including chitosan, and their potential applications in dental fields such as implantology, endodontics, and regenerative dentistry.
results_summary: The study highlights solid evidence supporting the advantages of organic nanomaterials, including chitosan, in various dental applications, emphasizing their potential for tissue regeneration and wound healing. Research is concentrated on chitosan and other nanocomposites, with ongoing development of new materials.
population_specificity: Not specified (broad focus on dental applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent advances in the use of chitosan nanosorbents for removing heavy-metal ions from wastewater and drinking water.
results_summary: The study highlights that chitosan nanosorbents perform very well in environmental remediation, effectively removing toxic heavy-metal ions from aqueous solutions, though some limitations are noted.
population_specificity: Not specified (environmental application, not human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the properties of Chitosan (CS) and its role, alone or combined with other materials, as a scaffold for bone tissue engineering (BTE).
results_summary: The abstract highlights Chitosan's suitability for BTE due to properties like porosity, biocompatibility, water retention, protein adsorption, mechanical strength, biomineralization, and biodegradability. It emphasizes CS's potential in combination with other polymeric and ceramic materials for bone tissue repair.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of general BTE applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of fungal-origin chitosan for weight loss in overweight and obese individuals without dietary restrictions.
results_summary: Chitosan significantly reduced body weight (3.10 kg over 90 days), improved body composition, anthropometric parameters, HbA1C levels, and quality of life, with no change in dietary habits. It was safe and well-tolerated, with only mild adverse events unrelated to treatment.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese subjects (n=96, 64 chitosan, 32 placebo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether the additional use of a chitosan nerve tube in primary microsurgical repair of traumatic sensory nerve lesions of the hand without a gap improves sensitivity recovery compared to standard repair alone.
results_summary: The study protocol describes a randomized double-blind controlled multicenter trial to evaluate the superiority of chitosan nerve tubes in sensory nerve repair, with static two-point discrimination after 6 months as the primary outcome. Results are not yet available as the study is ongoing.
population_specificity: 100 participants with traumatic sensory nerve lesions of the hand without a gap from three Trauma Care Centers.
